notes:
For the first round, there are two main options depending on how the draft is shaping up:

If the draft is favorable or slightly favorable*, you can go for a more aggressive build:  [Compensator](item_2a354f80-610c-4661-9bdd-8960ae1a60b0) +  [Power Playbook](item_6d8803cf-baa7-46ee-af91-51e7f2301418). Plus a defensive item — I personally prefer and recomend  [Armored Vest](item_358361e2-59be-4c81-b221-8a87f37809e6)  but  [Siphon Gloves](item_099f8177-c2a4-4e13-b321-99349f8b1eb7) is also a solid choice depending on your comfort and playstyle.

If the matchup looks bad for you, I recommend taking a more defensive approach with two survivability items:  [Armored Vest](item_358361e2-59be-4c81-b221-8a87f37809e6)  + either  [First Aid Kit](item_0172eaaa-1902-44a3-b989-d12f0f7301da) or  [Siphon Gloves](item_099f8177-c2a4-4e13-b321-99349f8b1eb7)

If you go with the second option (the defensive start), your main objective during the first two rounds is to survive as long as possible, maintain consistent uptime, deal constant damage, and earn as much gold as you can.

When it comes to Power selection, I believe  [Iaido Strike](item_0b4def91-53c9-4bb7-b706-05aff6e4b168) is the best option in terms of overall damage.

Since we’ll be taking  [Hidden Blade](item_a820416d-85e5-4018-b20a-dc1cbf744900)  as our second power, there’s an argument to be made for picking that one first instead. However, if you’re prioritizing raw burst damage, Iaido Strike is the superior choice to start with.

*If needed, you can refer to the main note of the build to check which matchups are favorable and which are not.

Second Round is more of a free-form choice depending on your comfort level — unless you can get  [Codebreaker](item_caa96c7e-655f-4d03-9bd9-0f41937fec27) , which is a priority. As Shooting Star points out in their melee build, Armor counters this playstyle well, so anti-armor is a great option. If you can pair Codebreaker with Armor, that’s the ideal setup. If you don’t have enough money, then Compensator is a decent fallback. And of course, if you can keep all your green items while picking up Codebreaker, that’s even better.

If Codebreaker isn’t an option, then you have two main paths to choose from, depending on your comfort and the enemies in front of you: Weapon Damage or Ability Power

Keep in mind two key things:

It's fundamental to maximize your income during the first rounds.

Blade — and by extension  [Iaido Strike](item_0b4def91-53c9-4bb7-b706-05aff6e4b168) — scales better with Ability Power.

Weapon Damage Path:
 [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a) or  [Technoleech](item_cb7fd8bf-bdcc-439a-ad35-372f24a027a8), depending on your gold. Pair it with  [Vital-E-Tee](item_b92e6f1d-3aac-4eec-b027-00c8e1529016) for survivability.

Ability Power Path:
 [Nano Cola](item_79b22609-8046-4a8a-a5a2-bb49cd7e11c6) or  [Multi-Tool](item_5ba8d94e-f2f3-44b7-8773-025fc6ed7c56), depending again on your budget.

 [Wrist Wraps](item_19183386-c859-42ca-93f2-355d47d01e36) can also be an option with the recent Genji adjustments — but if you go that route, I recommend selling  [Compensator](item_2a354f80-610c-4661-9bdd-8960ae1a60b0) for [Weapon Grease](item_961ae72f-434f-406b-a89b-ab8efec806bf). In all cases, pair your main item with  [Vital-E-Tee](item_b92e6f1d-3aac-4eec-b027-00c8e1529016) for sustain.

Round 3 is where you hit your first and biggest power spike — from this point on, Genji becomes a consistent threat throughout the rest of the game.

If you weren’t able to buy  [Codebreaker](item_caa96c7e-655f-4d03-9bd9-0f41937fec27) in Round 2, now’s the time to get it. You'll also unlock [Hidden Blade], and that brings us to your choice for the second item:  [Ambusher Optics](item_742c3c71-17cd-4fa7-bf18-ddeae7d521ca) or  [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7).

So, how do you decide between the two?

Gloom is the better option if:
- You feel you lack the mechanical consistency to land melee hits from behind.
- You’re facing very mobile enemies.

Gloom is more reliable overall, and the added armor and lifesteal offer great survivability, especially in chaotic fights.

Ambusher, on the other hand, is the "mathematically correct" choice when it comes to raw burst damage.
Pick it only if you’re confident in your ability to consistently land backstab melees, as it has a much higher damage ceiling when used correctly.

Regardless of which power you choose, pair  [Codebreaker](item_caa96c7e-655f-4d03-9bd9-0f41937fec27) and one of these two with as many green items as possible, prioritizing green survivability items like [Siphon Gloves](item_099f8177-c2a4-4e13-b321-99349f8b1eb7) (now way better with Hidden Blade) and [Armored Vest](item_358361e2-59be-4c81-b221-8a87f37809e6).

Also, if you're struggling against beam damage in this match, you can pick up  [Anti-Beam Coating](item_1ab73e1c-aaa1-4026-89cd-68404db7fd93). However, keep in mind that buying it will slow down your damage scaling, so only do it if Zarya is really on top of you or if they have more than one beam hero.

Round 4 is all about building on the momentum from Round 3. At this point, you have several viable paths depending on how well the previous round went:

If Round 3 went well, you should have enough gold to pick up the other melee item. If you chose  [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7)  in Round 3, now pick up  [Ambusher Optics](item_742c3c71-17cd-4fa7-bf18-ddeae7d521ca) and the other way around.

If Round 3 went exceptionally well, you can consider going for:
- If you're running  [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7), then  [Eye of the Spider](item_bbaf01d7-340d-4199-b738-86a98d68fe9b) is a good choice.
- If you picked  [Ambusher Optics](item_742c3c71-17cd-4fa7-bf18-ddeae7d521ca), then  [The Closer](item_173c6d0f-dbe6-440e-924f-0ce08189ddce) is the best pairing to maximize burst and close out kills efficiently.

If Round 3 went poorly, your priority shifts to economical recovery with blue items:
- For damage:  [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a) or  [Technoleech](item_cb7fd8bf-bdcc-439a-ad35-372f24a027a8) 
- For survivability:  [Vital-E-Tee](item_b92e6f1d-3aac-4eec-b027-00c8e1529016) and  [Ironclad Exhaust Ports](item_2d085fa5-ace6-4fab-9323-b7a06268bcd0)  are both strong defensive options.

Round 5 requires you to understand the current state of the game:
What kind of matchup are you facing? How well are you performing? Which enemies are causing you the most trouble, and which should you prioritize? Based on this assessment, you have two distinct paths with different power options to choose from.

**Consistency and Survivability:**
This option is ideal if you are already in a strong position and executing your plan effectively and consistently. The powers in this path are designed to help you maintain the strengths you gained from your earlier powers. Your choices here are  [Hanamura Healing](item_d210417d-1e30-4571-a4f3-cccd1dfc23ca) and  [Forged Under Fire](item_b60b1aa3-e69d-4d19-b3d8-43de1cce110c) . If you decide to take this route, it’s very likely you will pick these powers in rounds 5 and 7. Prioritize them based on your current situation and the enemies you face. If you have doubts about wich of these two you should get first ill recommend  [Hanamura Healing](item_d210417d-1e30-4571-a4f3-cccd1dfc23ca) 

**Shift to Ability Power for a Hybrid, Full-Damage Build:**
In this approach, you invest power into Swift Strike to increase your damage output and apply more pressure on the enemy team. While the consistency path is generally more reliable, this damage-focused option excels in certain situations — especially when the enemy team has highly mobile heroes that are difficult to hit consistently and it shines on maps where enemies tend to stick close together. The power to pick here is  [Laceration](item_ee831ad3-3921-4aca-a761-c6b93cc7e7fe), as it maximizes damage in those clustered fights.

Your item choices should also align with the path you've chosen. If you’re following the consistency path, you should continue investing in weapon damage and survivability in the upcoming rounds. The best two items for boosting your damage are  [The Closer](item_173c6d0f-dbe6-440e-924f-0ce08189ddce) and  [Eye of the Spider](item_bbaf01d7-340d-4199-b738-86a98d68fe9b).

For survivability, your top choices are  [Nebula Conduit](item_476b7040-54c9-4f0c-8283-b4407f6809f8) and  [Ogundimu Reduction Field](item_b12daf48-069b-44c1-88fe-221cbcff664d). However, since your power selection already provides survivability, it’s better to focus on damage items this round. The recommended item priority is:

1. Eye of the Spider
2. The Closer
3. Nebula Conduit

The hybrid path ask of us to buy ability power items, we are not selling the three main items ([Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7),  [Ambusher Optics](item_742c3c71-17cd-4fa7-bf18-ddeae7d521ca) and  [Codebreaker](item_caa96c7e-655f-4d03-9bd9-0f41937fec27)) but rather buy two ability power items and one survival item in the next 3 rounds. The ability power options are  [Iridescent Iris](item_b7fb28ef-ce82-416b-8693-01c274f8df4e) and [Champion's Kit](item_8682f8c7-8811-439b-8d50-fa81cd43ddce) with  [Nebula Conduit](item_476b7040-54c9-4f0c-8283-b4407f6809f8) as the survival item. The order you buy them will depend on your economy during this rounds.

We continue with what we stablished in round 5.

If you go for the first option pick whichever is left to pick between  [The Closer](item_173c6d0f-dbe6-440e-924f-0ce08189ddce) and [Eye of the Spider](item_bbaf01d7-340d-4199-b738-86a98d68fe9b) 

Same with the hybrid build, either [Champion's Kit](item_8682f8c7-8811-439b-8d50-fa81cd43ddce) or [Iridescent Iris](item_b7fb28ef-ce82-416b-8693-01c274f8df4e).

In both builds, if you feel you need defences go for [Nebula Conduit](item_476b7040-54c9-4f0c-8283-b4407f6809f8) and leave the last damage item for last round.

So last round. We will finish our build with a Survival Item or, if you bought survival item last round, the last damage item. 

When it comes to powers if you choose the consistency build you will get  [Forged Under Fire](item_b60b1aa3-e69d-4d19-b3d8-43de1cce110c). You could also get  [Laceration](item_ee831ad3-3921-4aca-a761-c6b93cc7e7fe) if you feel you’re tanky enough and need extra damage to close out kills.

In the Hybrid build we have diferent options: 
- For me [Wyrm’s Maw](item_5d8c3488-13a9-432a-987e-275522f68cc4) is the best option when it comes to damage, although at this point depending on enemy composition and their items, more damage can be overkill which is somethintg you should be careful about since then, power and money should be then investetd in utility instead.
- [Hanamura Healing](item_d210417d-1e30-4571-a4f3-cccd1dfc23ca) can be a good option for survival.
- [Spirit of Sojiro](item_273ac0b7-f669-4641-bd77-2826aadd3218) Lets you cast Swift Strike more often and proc [Laceration](item_ee831ad3-3921-4aca-a761-c6b93cc7e7fe) more constantly.

Hope this build + guide helps you climb, feel free to ask me any question or giving me feedback. Good luck in your games! ♥
